questions.question: ………………………… your shoes off.
questions.description: The simple present is used in imperative sentence.

questions.question: She ……………………………. younger than her elder sister.
questions.description: We use the simple present to talk about facts.

questions.question: How did you ………………………… then?
questions.description: The infinitive without to is used after do, does and did.

questions.question: ……………………… forget to close the door when you leave.
questions.description: The simple present is used in imperative sentences. In imperatives the subject is you.

questions.question: The cop asked him what he ………………………………… doing there.
questions.description: When the verb in the main clause is in the past tense, we use a past tense in the subordinate clause as well.

questions.question: I …………………………… my mother every day.
questions.description: Use the simple present to talk about habits.

questions.question: The cat ……………………………. her litter.
questions.description: Has had is in the present perfect tense. The present perfect is used to give news.

questions.question: If we do not take precautions, we …………………………….. in trouble.
questions.description: In the first conditional, use a simple present tense in the if-clause and will + first form of the verb in the main clause.

questions.question: I ………………………………. her since our school days.
questions.description: We use the present perfect to talk about life experiences up to now.

questions.question: Somebody wanted a drink, …………………………….?
questions.description: They is used in question tags after somebody, anybody, nobody.

questions.question: I would rather you …………………………… talking to her.
questions.description: The past tense is used in this construction.
